channel.title: Gtx 560ti and Ubuntu
channel.description: Well I installed a GTX 560ti awhile back and on my Ubuntu I have installed the Nvidia 304 proprietary drivers, and about every 25 minutes or so I will get these strange light pink and green squares of dots all over the screen then the whole operating system goes unresponsive. If I have music playing in the background it will continue to play until I manually reset the computer. I have the same issue with Windows except it is much more rare and only happens around once every 3 or 4 days. I have tried switching between the 310 drivers and the default generic drivers, and I get the same result with all of them. Is there anyways this can be fixed? Or is this a defective card?

item.title: Gtx 560ti and Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I’ve noticed the crash only occurs when I am using flash player. I often listen to music in the background on Grooveshark, and I haven’t been on there today and I’ve had no crashes.

I also went into /etc/X11/xorg.conf and added under “devices”

Option "UseEvents" "False"

I just read on a bug log somewhere that adding that option will help reduce crashes. Not sure if it will or not.
